alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 01 at 2:49AM PST until January 01 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Surf of 7 to 10 feet will continue through this morning on west to northwest facing beaches. Strong and dangerous rip currents will continue. As surf and tide levels gradually diminish, the threat of coastal flooding has diminished. * WHERE...San Luis Obispo County Beaches and Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Another round of high surf and dangerous rip current is expected to return to the Cedntral Coast late Tuesday night through Thursday, when breakers of 10 to 15 feet with locally higher sets can be expected acros west and northwest facing beaches.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches
